shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä täʾamno ḫaṭawǝʾ “Book of the Confession of Sins“ (fols. 1va-2vb, 5vb-6rb, 9ra-10vb). Incipit: መጽሐፈ፡ ተአምኖ፡ ኃጣውእ፡ ዘተቀድሐ፡ እም፹፡ ወ፩፡ መጻሕፍት፡ ሥርዋ፡ ለኃጢአት፡ አፍቅሮ፡ ንዋይ፡ ወቀቲለፍስ፡[sic for ቀቲለ፡ ነፍስ] II) Four ʾanbǝro ʾǝd preceded by other short liturgical texts (fols. 3ra-5vb) III) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 11ra-29ra) IV) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 29rb-54rb) V) Anaphoras (fols. 54rb-142vb) V-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 54rb-78va) V-2) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 78vb-85ra) V-3) Anaphora of St. Gregory of Nyssa (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 85rb-92ra) V-4) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 92ra-97vb) V-5) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 97vb-100va) V-6) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 100vb-109rb) V-7) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 109rb-115ra) V-8) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 115ra-124ra) V-9) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 124rb-136ra) V-10) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 136rb-142vb), incomplete
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Täklä Haymanot (mentioned in supplication formulas, s. fol. 136rb, etc.; in some places his name has been erased, s. fol. 124rb).

dcomments.dcomment: On fols. 17va, 28ra, 28rb, 52ra, Fasilädäs (r. 1632-67) is mentioned as the reigning King. Marqos is mentioned as the Patriarch and Yoḥannǝs as the Metropolitan on fol. 43vb. Marqos mentioned as the Patriarch and another Marqos as the Metropolitan on fol. 52rb. Mark VI was Patriarch of Alexandria in 1645-60; Marqos III was Metropolitan of Ethiopia from 1635 to ca. 1648; Yoḥannǝs was one of the two bishops that arrived in Ethiopia to succeed Marqos III, but was never officially proclaimed Metropolitan.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. The end part of Text V-10 is missing. Boundaries between some of the quires are difficult to establish, as many leaves were later sewn together by means of additional crude threads. Back cover is missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (back board is missing); Two pairs of sewing stations.

squires.squire:
<I(10/s. l.: 2, stub after 9; 2, stub after 9/fols. 1r-10v)> – II(10/fols. 11r-20v) – III(9/fols. 21r-29v) – IV(8/fols. 30r-37v) – V(6/fols. 38r-43v) – VI(4/fols. 44r-47v) – VII(10/fols. 48r-57v) – VIII(10/fols. 58r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – X(11/fols. 76r-86v) – XI(10/fols. 87r-96v) – XII(10/fols. 97r-106v) – XIII(10/fols. 107r-116v) – XIV(10/fols. 117r-126v) – XV(8/fols. 127r-134v) – XVI(8/fols. 135r-142v).
Quire I, comprising Texts I and II written by different hands and usually absent from Missals, was probably added to the Ms. later. Boundaries between some of the quires are difficult to establish.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 117r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 56r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 117r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 56r). Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the King, Patriarch and Metropolitan; name of the owner; headings and incipits of the texts; directives for the ministers; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
In fol. 11r, the text is written alternately in red and black lines. Occasionally incipits of other texts are also written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 78vb, 92ra, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይ፡ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይ፡ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: For Text I, cp. Mss. EMML 573 (early 20th cent., Addis Ababa, parish church), fols. 88r-96r, and esp. EMML 2873 (18th cent., ʾAnkobärr, parish church), fols. 170v-173r (the incipit of this text coincides with the incipit of Text I).

additional.cont: Fols. 7ra-8ra: Prayer to God.
additional.add: Fol. 7ra: እገኒ፡ ለከ፡ እግዚአ [sic]፡ አምላኪየ፡ አኃዜ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዓለም፡ ዘትነብር፡ ዲበ፡ ሰረገላ፡ ኪሩቤል፡ ወሱራፌል፡...
additional.tran: Fol. 7ra: I praise Thee, Lord my God, the Keeper of the whole world, who sitst upon the chariot of Cherubim and Seraphim...
additional.det: Crudely written in reddish-brown ink; the end part is hardly legible.

extras.extra: - Fol. 1r: Crude notes, in black ink (writing exercise?). - Fol. 2r: in the bottom margin. Crude notes. - Fols. 11r, 11v, 12r, 12v (in the upper margin): Crude notes, in violet ink, apparently one coherent text. - Fols. 15r, 19v, 21r, 21v, 22r (in the upper margin): Crude notes, in violet ink, some of them hardly legible. - Fols. 39v, 40r, 41r, 41v, 80r, etc. (in the upper margin): Crude notes. - Fols. 49v, 68r, 73r, etc. (in the upper margin): Corrections or additions to the main text.

frames.frame: Chains of black and red dots, sometimes with three nine dot asterisks between them (fols. 85ra, 100va, 115ra, 124ra, etc.).
